macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global stocks steady near record highs ahead of key US CPI and earnings season kickoff
items.summary: Major equity indices ended the previous session near record or cycle highs as investors positioned cautiously ahead of this week’s US CPI release and the start of Q4 earnings, particularly from large US banks. Flows reflect optimism about 2026 Fed rate cuts tempered by concern that hotter-than-expected inflation could spur volatility.
items.source: Daily Sabah / Investing.com / StoneX market commentary

items.title: S&P 500 and Dow close at or near all-time highs after strong first full week of 2026
items.summary: US stocks finished the prior session and week higher, with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average at record or near-record levels following mixed but resilient labor data and ongoing expectations for further Fed easing. Broader participation beyond mega-cap tech has supported the advance, with small caps and cyclicals also gaining.

items.title: US dollar firms while S&P 500 momentum slows after fresh record, as traders eye inflation and Fed path
items.summary: The US Dollar Index printed a large bullish weekly candlestick, reflecting firmer US data that added a slightly more hawkish tilt to 2026 rate-cut expectations, even as markets still price two 25 bp cuts. The S&P 500 notched a new all‑time high late last week, but technical analysts note that upside momentum has moderated into the latest session.

items.title: Fed officials’ speeches in focus as markets hunt clues on 2026 rate cuts
items.summary: Remarks from New York Fed President John Williams and Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin are a key focus for traders, who are watching for any guidance on the timing and scale of 2026 rate cuts. A more dovish tone could pressure Treasury yields and support growth stocks, while hawkish messaging may boost the dollar and weigh on risk assets.
items.source: Sergey Tereshkin – Economic Events and Corporate Reports

items.title: Markets brace for crucial US CPI and PPI reports that could reshape Fed expectations
items.summary: Investors are positioning around this week’s US CPI release, expected to show annual inflation near 2.7%, and follow‑on PPI and retail sales data that will refine the inflation and growth picture. These prints are among the last major inputs before the Fed’s late‑January meeting and could alter the path and pace of expected 2026 rate cuts.

items.title: Strategists say 2026 inflation may surprise to the downside, supporting US equity earnings growth
items.summary: Wall Street forecasters highlight easing shelter costs and cheap oil as reasons inflation could drift lower, with Goldman Sachs projecting the Fed’s preferred PCE gauge trending back toward 2%. This backdrop, combined with AI‑driven productivity gains, underpins forecasts for double‑digit S&P 500 earnings-per-share growth in 2026 and 2027.

items.title: Earnings season set to begin with major US banks, seen as critical gauge of economic health
items.summary: Large US banks will kick off Q4 earnings this week, giving investors an early read on credit quality, loan growth, and capital markets activity. Analysts expect S&P 500 earnings to have grown about 13% in 2025 with projections for another 15% increase in 2026, making bank guidance a key test of those optimistic forecasts.

items.title: Morgan Stanley favored ahead of Q4 results on stronger dealmaking and IPO pipeline
items.summary: Analysts highlight Morgan Stanley as a potential outperformer this week, citing a rebound in mergers and acquisitions, robust IPO underwriting, and solid core investment banking performance. The stock is seen as well positioned to benefit if earnings confirm the recovery in capital markets activity.

items.title: Capital One faces pressure amid proposed cap on US credit card interest rates
items.summary: Capital One Financial is flagged as vulnerable as policymakers consider capping credit card interest rates, a move that could compress margins and earnings. The regulatory overhang adds to investor caution toward consumer credit‑exposed financials just as the sector heads into earnings season.

items.title: India’s record-low inflation and Japan trade data shape Asian macro backdrop
items.summary: Asian trading is being influenced by fresh data showing inflation in India at record lows and new Japanese trade figures, developments that could affect regional monetary policy stances and capital flows. These releases come as global investors rebalance positions ahead of US inflation data and central bank commentary.
items.source: Sergey Tereshkin – Economic Events and Corporate Reports

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin trades above $91,000 with modest daily gain as broader crypto market steadies
items.summary: Bitcoin is trading around $91,022 on Binance after crossing the $91,000 mark, posting a relatively small 24-hour increase of about 0.6%, suggesting a period of consolidation rather than sharp volatility in the top cryptocurrency.

items.title: Altcoin market sees sharp divergence as Polygon surges while majors dip slightly
items.summary: Over the past day within a broadly flat major-coin environment, Polygon’s POL token extended a strong weekly rally of nearly 50%, while Bitcoin and Ethereum each slipped less than 2%, highlighting continued rotation into select altcoins despite muted overall market moves.

items.title: Coinbase intensifies lobbying as key U.S. crypto market-structure bill heads to Senate markup
items.summary: Coinbase is ramping up pressure on U.S. lawmakers over a major crypto market-structure bill set for Senate markup this week, warning it may withdraw support if stablecoin-reward restrictions go beyond enhanced disclosure, a dispute that could delay passage of comprehensive digital-asset legislation.

items.title: U.S. Senate Banking Committee schedules review of Digital Asset Market Transparency (CLARITY) Act
items.summary: The U.S. Senate Banking Committee has formally set a date this week to deliberate the Digital Asset Market Transparency Act, also known as the Crypto Market Structure Act, marking a pivotal step in efforts to define federal rules for cryptocurrency trading and market oversight.

items.title: Coinbase to suspend MKR trading and transfers during MKR-to-SKY migration
items.summary: Coinbase announced it will support Maker’s token migration from MKR to SKY at a fixed conversion rate and will temporarily suspend MKR trading and transfers during the migration window, requiring users who do not want automatic conversion to withdraw to self-custody beforehand.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI insiders launch 'Poison Fountain' project to deliberately poison training data
items.summary: A small group of unidentified AI industry insiders has launched the 'Poison Fountain' initiative, urging website operators to embed links that serve subtly incorrect and bug‑ridden code and data to AI crawlers in order to poison future training corpora and highlight model vulnerability to data poisoning attacks.

items.title: Analysts: ASIC-based AI inference servers set to grow faster than GPU servers in 2026
items.summary: Taiwan’s Market Intelligence and Consulting Institute forecasts that shipments of servers used for AI inference will be about four times higher than those for training this year, with application-specific integrated circuit (ASIC) servers for inference expected to grow faster than GPU-based systems as cloud providers scale deployment efficiency and cost control.

items.title: Packworks reports 46% sales jump for sari-sari stores using AI decision tools
items.summary: Philippine startup Packworks.io found that small neighborhood sari-sari stores using its AI-powered recommendations saw a 46% boost in daily gross merchandise value and a 17% rise in total sales over a two‑week period, even while operating on 20% fewer selling days, highlighting practical AI adoption in microretail operations.

items.title: BFL Canada urges firms to tighten AI safety as data exposure incidents double in two years
items.summary: BFL Canada is warning businesses to strengthen AI safety practices, citing IBM data that approximately 26% of companies globally have experienced AI-related data exposure incidents, up from 13% two years ago, underscoring growing operational and security risks from enterprise AI adoption.

items.title: Case study highlights privacy-preserving machine learning as strategically important AI niche
items.summary: An immigration case study details the fast EB-2 NIW approval of a software engineer specializing in privacy-preserving machine learning techniques such as federated learning, differential privacy, and encrypted cloud applications, underscoring growing U.S. recognition of privacy-focused AI research as a field of substantial national interest.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: BioWare's Anthem reaches permanent server shutdown date, becoming unplayable
items.summary: EA and BioWare’s live-service shooter Anthem hits its previously announced permanent server shutdown on January 12, 2026, rendering both multiplayer and single-player content inaccessible due to its always-online requirement and effectively removing the game from circulation.

items.title: Anthem server closure fuels criticism of online-only game preservation
items.summary: With Anthem’s servers going dark and all purchased copies and premium currency becoming unusable, commentators highlight the shutdown as a key example for anti–‘Stop Killing Games’ advocates and a warning about the risks of always-online design in AAA titles.

items.title: Dystopian sim LOW VALUE JOB launches on Steam for PC
items.summary: Indie title LOW VALUE JOB, described as a dystopian job simulation game, is now available on Steam for PC, developed by YAYOI KAIHATSU and published by Distillate G.K., with its official release dated January 12, 2026.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass 'Last Chance' sale cuts 30+ games by up to 90%
items.summary: Microsoft’s Xbox Game Pass 'Last Chance' sale offers deep discounts of up to 90% on more than 30 titles for subscribers, framed as an opportunity to grab older and departing catalog games at very low prices.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: SpaceX Receives FCC Approval to Launch 7,500 Additional Starlink Satellites
items.summary: SpaceX has been granted FCC permission to launch another 7,500 second-generation Starlink satellites, bringing total authorization to 15,000 Gen2 satellites. The expansion will enable global high-speed, low-latency internet service with enhanced mobile coverage.

items.title: Starlink Begins Major Satellite Constellation Reconfiguration for Space Safety
items.summary: SpaceX announced that approximately 4,400 Starlink satellites will be moved from an altitude of 341 miles to 298 miles over the course of 2026 as part of a significant reconfiguration focused on increasing space safety.

items.title: Retail Technology Innovations Showcased at NRF Big Show 2026
items.summary: Direct Source is highlighting AI-driven checkout solutions, RFID-powered experiences, and enhanced in-store engagement tools at the National Retail Federation's annual conference, demonstrating advancements in retail technology infrastructure.
